LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Processamento de consultas em redes de sensores sem fio
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: O objeto de investigaзгo desta linha de pesquisa й o processamento adaptativo de consultas em Redes de Sensores sem Fio (RSSFs). O objetivo й tornar o processamento da consulta adaptбvel а disponibilidade de recursos (bateria e memуria) dos nуs da rede. LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Utilizaзгo de Memуrias de Estado Sуlido para Armazenar Bancos de Dados
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: A set of new storage media, called Storage Class Memory (SCM), has emerged as a quite promising solution to decrease the difference between HDD data access time and the time that processors can consume data. Four main characteristics may be highlighted in SCM: (i) non-volatility; (ii) low access time; (iii) high # IOPS, and (iv) read/write execution time asymmetry. The read-write speed ratio can reach an 1-to-300 factor. For that reason,database techniques should be revisited. The main goal of this research line is to provide an empirical study on the use of SCMs by database systems. Furthermore, we try to point out strategies on how to redesign database architectural components and techniques to profit from the use of SCMs.

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Auto-sintonia de Sistemas de Banco de Dados
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Database applications have become very complex, dealing with a huge volume of data and database objects. Concurrently, low query response time and high transaction throughput have emerged as mandatory requirements to be ensured by database management systems. However, manual adjustment of database physical configuration requires a thorough knowledge on DBMS implementation aspects, hardware capacity, physical database design strategies, stored data characteristics and complex workloads. The key goal of this research line is to develop techniques and tools which are able to automatically take decisions that a DBA could take regarding database system performance.

A linha de pesquisa visa investigar o impacto do paradigma de computaзгo mуvel na tecnologia de banco de dados. Para tanto, estб sendo desenvolvida uma arquitetura para um ambiente composto por sistemas de bancos de dados mуveis com a finalidade de tornar tais sistemas interoperбveis. Os sistemas deverгo estar interconectados por sistema de comunicaзгo sem fio, que pode ser, por exemplo, uma rede ad hoc (rede dinamicamente configurбvel) ou um sistema celular mуvel. A arquitetura proposta deverб viabilizar a interoperabilidade de sistemas de banco de dados existentes no mercado, garantindo, dessa forma, o acesso a dados armazenados em mъltiplas unidades mуveis. A idйia й que os sistemas de bancos de dados que residam em unidades mуveis comportem-se como uma comunidade (federaзгo) de bancos de dados. O foco serб desenvolver tйcnicas para o processamento de consultas, integraзгo de bancos de dados heterogкneos, autфnomos e mуveis e gerenciamento de transaзхes mуveis.

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Integraзгo de Bancos de Dados Heterogкnos em Ambientes Dinamicamente Configurбveis
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Ambientes dinamicamente configurбveis sгo caracterizados pela alta independкncia dos participantes da conexгo, pelo baixo controle sobre os serviзos solicitados e disponibilizados e pela necessidade de uma alta tolerвncia аs falhas de comunicaзгo. Assim, o objetivo seria o de se projetar novos mйtodos e tйcnicas que viessem minimizar o consumo de energia por parte de RSSFs. A segunda perspectiva seria a de utilizar RSSFs como instrumento para minimizar os efeitos da aзгo do ser humano sobre o meio ambiente. Segundo esta perspectiva, o objetivo seria o de se construir aplicaзхes de RSSFs que ajudem a enfrentar o desafio de se garantir a sustentabilidade ambiental. Neste projeto de pesquisa, serгo propostos e desenvolvidos novos mйtodos, tйcnicas e algoritmos de RSSFs orientados para atender aos princнpios da Computaзгo Verde, almejando-se tornar RSSFs mais eficientes quanto ao consumo de energia.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: SoftDB: A Software-Agent based Tool for Cloud-Database Intelligent Tuning
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: the key goal of this project is to build an intelligent, interaction-aware, online and autonomous tool, called SoftDB, for automatic database tuning in cloud infrastructure. The SoftDB tool should be based on the concept of software agents collaboration and should be able to perform tuning on index structures, materialized views, table partitions, alternative clustering, SQL statements. The SoftDB tool captures and evaluates the workload executed by tenant DBMSs in order to autonomously make decisions aiming at performance gains w.r.t. query response time and transaction throughput. Moreover, the proposed approach is able to dynamically react to workload changes and it is independent of any human intervention.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O projeto tem como objetivo o desenvolvimento de um framework composto por duas hierarquias de classe primitivas: 1.Hierarquia de Classe de Armazenamento. Esta hierarquia, denominada de DBLib, tem como principal funcionalidade prover uma camada de abstraзгo entre aplicaзгo e arquivos Palm, com o objetivo de abstrair o conceito de arquivo para desenvolvedores de aplicaзгo Palm. Com isto, qualquer aplicaзгo veria o conceito de banco de dados e nгo mais de arquivos Palm (.pdb, pro exemplo). Com a implementaзгo desta camada de abstraзгo, um desenvolvedor de aplicaзгo Palm pode manipular bancos de dados com suas tabelas, restriзхes de integridade, como chave primбria (integridade de chave) ou chave estrangeira (integridade referencial). Tambйm sгo disponibilizadas API's para manipular estas estruturas como: (i) a inclusгo ou exclusгo de uma coluna em uma tabela existente; (ii) inserзгo, exclusгo, alteraзгo ou busca dos dados armazenados nas tabelas; (iii) exclusгo de uma tabela ou de um banco de dados. 2.Hierarquia de Classe de Conectividade. Esta hierarquia, denominada de ConnLib, foi desenvolvida com a finalidade de se criar uma camada de abstraзгo entre aplicaзхes Palm e APIs de conexгo a redes sem fio. O objetivo desta camada de abstraзгo й tornar transparente para a aplicaзгo qual infra-estrutura de comunicaзгo sem fio estб sendo utilizada (bluetooth, WiFi, GPRS ou infra-vermelho). Adicionalmente, as APIs dгo suporte para o handoff vertical (aзгo de mudar de uma tecnologia de comunicaзгo para outra) de forma transparente para o usuбrio, por exemplo, de WiFi para Bluetooth.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We define a Mobile Database Community (MDBC) as a dynamic collection of autonomous mobile databases in which each database user can access databases in the community through a wireless communication infrastructure. New participants may join to an MDBC as they move within communication range of one or more hosts which are members of the MDBC. On other hand, MDBC participants may transiently disconnect from the network due to communication disruptions or to save power. For that reason, an MDBC can be characterized as a dynamically configurable environment. This paper describes an agent-based architecture, called AMDB (Accessing Mobile Databases), which enables such communities to be formed opportunistically over mobile database hosts in ad hoc configurable environments. The AMDB architecture is fully distributed and exploits physical mobility of hosts and logical mobility of database queries and their results across mobile hosts. A prototype of the proposed architecture is currently being developed based on the IBM agent system, called AGLETS.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: As tecnologias de computadores mуveis (portбteis) e comunicaзгo sem fio (sistema de comunicaзгo atravйs ondas de rбdio, como, por exemplo, rede de pacotes digitais celulares, sistema de comunicaзгo via satйlite e redes ad hoc) jб se tornaram uma realidade no ambiente computacional moderno. A integraзгo destas duas tecnologias viabiliza que novas versхes de computadores mуveis conectem-se, como componentes, a um ambiente computacional distribuнdo. Neste novo cenбrio, um computador mуvel poder mudar constantemente sua localizaзгo fнsica e, ao mesmo tempo, continuar funcionando como componente do ambiente distribuнdo. Em outras palavras, apesar de apresentar localizaзгo fixa em uma rede, um computador mуvel pode acessar e disponibilizar recursos em um ambiente distribuнdo. Este novo contexto forneceu as condiзхes necessбrias para surgimento do paradigma de computaзгo mуvel. Este trabalho visa descrever e analisar as propostas para o processamento de consultas, integraзгo de bancos de dados heterogкneos, autфnomos e mуveis e gerenciamento de transaзхes mуveis.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In an environment with support for mobile computing, we may have a collection of autonomous, distributed, heterogeneous and mobile databases, denoted Mobile Database Community (MDBC), in which each database user can access databases in the community through a wireless communication infrastructure. In such an environment, new participants may join to an MDBC as they move within communication range of one or more hosts which are members of the MDBC. Furthermore, MDBC participants may transiently disconnect from the network due to communication disruptions or to save power. Therefore, an MDBC can be characterized as a dynamically configurable environment. This paper describes an agent-based architecture, denoted AMDB (Accessing Mobile Databases), which enables such communities to be formed opportunistically over mobile database hosts in ad hoc configurable environments. The AMDB architecture is fully distributed and has the capability of exploiting physical mobility of hosts and logical mobility of database queries and their results across mobile hosts.

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BRAYNER, A.;Brayner, A;Brayner, Angelo;BRAYNER, A.;BRAYNER, ВNGELO;Brayner, A.R.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Mobile Database Community (MDBC) is a dynamic collection of autonomous mobile databases in which each database user can access each other's database through a wireless communication infrastructure. Such communities can be formed opportunistically over mobile database hosts in ad hoc configurable environments. In this work, we present an approach for controlling concurrency in MDBCs. The proposed correctness criterion provides a high degree of inter-transaction parallelism and ensures consistency of the local database. A prototype implementation for the proposed transaction processing mechanism is currently being developed based on the IBM agent system, called AGLETS.

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BRAYNER, A.;Brayner, A;Brayner, Angelo;BRAYNER, A.;BRAYNER, ВNGELO;Brayner, A.R.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A broadcast environment is defined as a mobile computing environment in which data are delivered to mobile clients by means of a broadcast-based mechanism. Of course, those applications have to see the most recent consistent database state. For that reason, in such a scenario, database servers should synchronize operations for ensuring data consistency and currency of data. However, conventional serializability-based concurrency control protocols are unsuitable for synchronizing transactions in broadcast environments. The major goal of this work is to present a new serializability-based protocol to synchronize transactions in data intensive applications. The proposed protocol saves battery power, since it ensures that mobile clients do not have to contact servers (for requiring locks, for example) to access data. Thus, mobile clients do not need to listen to the broadcast continuously, they listen to the broadcast channel to retrieve data they need. That means, the proposed protocol supports client disconnections. Furthermore, the proposed protocol saves the use of mobile-clients computational resources. That is because it does not require that clients have to manage complex structures as those proposed in [Shan99] and in [Pit02] for controlling concurrency in broadcast environments. We performed extensive simulation analysis to evaluate the performance of the new protocol. The simulation results show that the proposed protocol better performance (lower abort rate, for example) than others protocols.

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BRAYNER, A.;Brayner, A;Brayner, Angelo;BRAYNER, A.;BRAYNER, ВNGELO;Brayner, A.R.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents the architecture and functional characteristics of MDBA (Mobile Data Base Administrator), a context-aware tool for remote data base administration that is executed in mobile devices. The MDBA allows the database administrator to perform his tasks, automatically identifying the databases and the wireless communication structure of a certain mobile computational environment. The proposed tool extends other requirements, integrating mobile computation with pervasive computation, resulting in a remote database administration approach for a new computational paradigm, the ubiquitous computation. This way, the MDBA tool provides database administration services anywhere and anytime. The technology J2ME was adopted to implement the proposed tool.

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BRAYNER, A.;Brayner, A;Brayner, Angelo;BRAYNER, A.;BRAYNER, ВNGELO;Brayner, A.R.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper proposes a conceptual data model, called ACQUA, for representing water resources. The proposed model has the capability of capturing the semantics of geographic phenomena, which are related with water resources, such as reservoirs, rivers, channels, pipelines, lakes and singularities (e.g. waterwithdrawal, waterdischarge, confluence, riverhead and monitoring-station). Using ACQUA it is possible to model the complex water resources network, its physical properties and its spatial information, within a geographic context. The model captures and represents information about an area and may be used as support for urban planning, water-related crisis management (such as, water offer and demand during a dry period) or as a basis for scenario simulation.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 19th Simpуsio Brasileiro de Banco de Dados

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BRAYNER, A.;Brayner, A;Brayner, Angelo;BRAYNER, A.;BRAYNER, ВNGELO;Brayner, A.R.

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-1: Integration of heterogeneous, automonous and distr

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Flexible and dynamic environments are characterized by high independence from connection participants, low control over available services and high tolerance to communication failures. Integrating data sources published on such environments requires an integration strategy that guarantees local data sources autonomy. Multidatabase System (MDBS) has been consolidated as an approach to integrate multiple heterogeneous and distributed data sources. A key property of MDBSs is to guarantee a higher degree of local than the other approaches for integrating heterogeneous data sources. MDBS technology uses a query language as integration mechanism, which is responsible for solving integration conflicts. Thus, the query language must provide constructs to perform queries over several different data sources. Furthermore, it should be capable for solving integration conflicts. This paper proposes an extension to the XQuery language, called MXQuery. The key feature of the proposed language is to provide mechanisms, which support the capability to jointly manipulate data in different data sources based on an XML data model.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Uma Comunidade de Bancos de Dados Mуveis (MDBC) representa uma coleзгo de bancos de dados mуveis e autфnomos. A utilizaзгo de tйcnicas tradicionais para processamento de consultas no acesso а banco de dados em uma MDBC tem se mostrado ineficiente devido а imprevisibilidade na taxa de acesso a bancos de dados da comunidade e a limitaзгo de memуria disponнvel nos dispositivos mуveis para a execuзгo de certos operadores, como a junзгo, por exemplo. A imprevisibilidade й provocada por quedas constantes na comunicaзгo entre os membros de uma MDBC (cenбrio comum em redes sem fio) e limitaзгo de processamento de certas unidades mуveis, atrasando a entrega de tuplas. Para tanto, novos protocolos devem ser definidos na бrea de banco de dados, com o objetivo de suportar as caracterнsticas desse novo ambiente. Dentro desse contexto, um dos problemas que vкm sendo discutidos й o do gerenciamento de transaзхes, ou seja, como garantir que vбrias operaзхes simultвneas realizadas por usuбrios distintos, em diversas fontes de dados, possam ocorrer, sem violar a consistкncia dos bancos de dados. Na бrea de banco de dados, o gerenciamento de transaзгo jб vem sendo estudado hб muito tempo, e alguns algoritmos jб propostos vкm sendo estendidos com o objetivo de atender os novos requisitos dessas aplicaзхes. Esse artigo apresenta uma anбlise evolutiva e comparativa dos protocolos de gerenciamento de transaзгo em banco de dados, atй chegar no ambiente de computaзгo mуvel.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: PDM - Palm Database Manager

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: MDBA: Mobile Database Administrator

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 6th International Conference on Mobile Data Management (MDM'05)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BRAYNER, A.;Brayner, A;Brayner, Angelo;BRAYNER, A.;BRAYNER, ВNGELO;Brayner, A.R.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The paper presents the MDBA (Mobile Data Base Administrator), a context-aware tool for remote data base administration that is executed in mobile devices. The MDBA enables database administrators (DBAs) to perform their tasks by automatically identifying databases and the wireless communication structure of a given ubiquitous computational environment. Therefore, the MDBA tool provides database administration services anywhere and anytime.
The 6th International Conference on Mobile Data Management (MDM'05) - Demo Session Ayia Napa, Cyprus, May 9-13, 2005 http://www2.cs.ucy.ac.cy/mdm05 Sponsored by IEEE TCDE/TCI, ACM SIGMOBILE/SIGMOD

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Increasing mobile transaction concurrency in dynamically configurable environments

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 3rd IEEE International Workshop on Mobile Distributed Computing
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 3rd IEEE International Workshop on Mobile Distributed Computing

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BRAYNER, A.;Brayner, A;Brayner, Angelo;BRAYNER, A.;BRAYNER, ВNGELO;Brayner, A.R.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The topology of a mobile ad hoc network (MANET) may change randomly and rapidly at unpredictable time, since nodes are free to move arbitrarily. The nodes represent mobile computers (hosts) in which database systems may reside. In such an environment, we may have a collection of autonomous, distributed, heterogeneous and mobile databases, where each database user (in a mobile host) can access databases of the collection through the wireless communication infrastructure. We call such a collection Mobile Database Community (MDBC). For several applications (e.g. battlefields or rescue operations) MDBC members need to access databases available in the same MDBC. This paper describes an approach for controlling concurrency in MDBCs. The proposed approach is based on the use of semantic knowledge to relax the notion of absolute transaction atomicity. Supported by this new concept of atomicity, we propose a new correctness criterion, denoted mobile semantic serializability, for the execution of concurrent transactions in MDBCs. The proposed correctness criterion provides a high degree of inter-transaction parallelism and ensures consistency of mobile databases. Two concurrency control protocols we have developed are described.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Towards database administration in pervasive computing environment

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IEEE International Conference on Pervasive Services (ICPS)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the IEEE International Conference on Pervasive Services

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BRAYNER, A.;Brayner, A;Brayner, Angelo;BRAYNER, A.;BRAYNER, ВNGELO;Brayner, A.R.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents a context-aware tool for remote data base administration that is executed in mobile devices, MDBA (Mobile Database Administrator). The MDBA enables database administrators (DBAs) to perform their tasks by automatically identifying databases and the wireless communication structure of a given mobile computational environment. The proposed tool has properties which integrate features of mobile computation pervasive computation paradigms and introduces also the notion of remote database administration, which is supported by a new computational paradigm, denoted ubiquitous computation. Therefore, the MDBA tool provides database administration services anywhere and anytime. Furthermore, the MDBA enables DBAs to manage databases residing in mobile hosts or fixed hosts.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Controlling Concurrency in Mobile Computing Environments with Broadcast-based Dissemination

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Euro-Par 2005
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Lecture Notes in Computer Science

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BRAYNER, A.;Brayner, A;Brayner, Angelo;BRAYNER, A.;BRAYNER, ВNGELO;Brayner, A.R.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A wireless broadcast environment is defined as a mobile computing environment in which data are delivered to mobile clients by means of a broadcast-based mechanism. Of course, those applications have to see the most recent consistent database state. For that reason, in such a scenario, database servers should synchronize operations for ensuring data consistency and currency of data. However, conventional serializability-based concurrency control protocols are unsuitable for synchronizing transactions in broadcast environments. The major goal of this work is to present a new serializability-based protocol to synchronize transactions in data intensive applications. The proposed protocol saves battery power, since it ensures that mobile clients do not have to contact servers (for requiring locks, for example) to access data. Thus, mobile clients do not need to listen to the broadcast continuously; they listen to the broadcast channel to retrieve data they need. Therefore, the proposed protocol supports client disconnections. We performed extensive simulation analysis to evaluate the performance of the new protocol. The simulation results show that the proposed protocol offers better performance than others protocols.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A Semantic-Serializability Based Fully-Distributed Concurrency Control Mechanism for Mobile Multi-Database Systems

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 8th International Workshop on Mobility in Database and Distributed Systems
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proccedings of the 8th International Workshop on Mobility in Database and Distributed Systems

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BRAYNER, A.;Brayner, A;Brayner, Angelo;BRAYNER, A.;BRAYNER, ВNGELO;Brayner, A.R.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The nodes of a mobile ad hoc network (MANET) represent mobile computers in which database systems (DBSs) may reside. In such an environment, we may have a mobile multidatabase system (mobile MDBS), i.e., a collection of autonomous, distributed, heterogeneous and mobile DBSs, where each mobile computer can access multiple databases of that collection by means of global transactions. In this paper we propose SESAMO, which is a concurrency control mechanism that does not require that a single mobile host (a node in MANET) plays the role of the centralized coordinator for all global transactions executed in the mobile MDBS. Moreover, SESAMO allows that subtransactions commit independently of the commitment of their respective global transactions, since it is based on the Semantic Serializability criterion, which relaxes global serializability.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Uma Arquitetura Eficiente para Armazenamento, Compressгo e Acesso a Dados em Dispositivos Mуveis com Recursos Computacionais Limitados

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XX Simpуsio Brasileiro de Banco de Dados
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do XX Simpуsio Brasileiro de Banco de Dados

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BRAYNER, A.;Brayner, A;Brayner, Angelo;BRAYNER, A.;BRAYNER, ВNGELO;Brayner, A.R.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The use of mobile devices such as handhelds and Personal Digital Assistants (PDAs) to data access anywhere and any time is becoming more common. However, PDAs devices have limited computational resources. Therefore, reduction of memory space and efficiency in accessing data are critical issues. This paper presents an efficient framework to data access, storage and compression in mobile devices with limited computational resources. In order to achieve our goal we have developed and implemented a storage structure and a mechanism to provide the access and management of compressed data. Experimental results show improvements of performance and reduction of required memory space to data storage.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Indexing Mobile Objects: A Strategy for Supporting Dynamic Channel Allocation in Cellular Networks

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IEEE International Conference on Wireless and Mobile Computing, Networking and Communications
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 2nd. IEEE International Conference on Wireless and Mobile Computing, Networking and Communications

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BRAYNER, A.;Brayner, A;Brayner, Angelo;BRAYNER, A.;BRAYNER, ВNGELO;Brayner, A.R.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In cellular networks, communication between mobile devices is accomplished through base stations (fixed antennas). The base station allocates communication channels whenever a mobile device (a cell phone, for example) in its area of coverage requests communication with some other device (mobile or fixed). With the rapidly growing number of mobile devices, the use of communication channels available in cellular networks needs to be optimized. Otherwise the network's bandwidth would have to be increased, raising operational costs significantly. To efficiently optimize the use of communication channels in cellular networks dynamic (on-the-fly) channel allocation may be employed, using an algorithm for the purpose; however such algorithms demand previous knowledge of the number of mobile devices in the area of coverage of a given base station. In this paper, we propose a strategy to support dynamic channel allocation in cellular networks by predicting the number of mobile devices in the area covered by a base station at any given moment. The proposed strategy is based on an indexing mechanism for mobile objects.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: ADAGA - ADaptive AGgregation Algorithm for sensor networks

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXI Simpуsio Brasileiro de Banco de Dados
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do XXI Simpуsio Brasileiro de Banco de Dados

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BRAYNER, A.;Brayner, A;Brayner, Angelo;BRAYNER, A.;BRAYNER, ВNGELO;Brayner, A.R.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Algorithms for query processing in Wireless Sensor Networks (WSNs) should be able to handle resource limitations such as memory and battery life. Adaptability has been explored as an alternative approach when dealing with these conditions. Adaptive algorithms can adjust their behavior in response to specific events that take place during data processing. In this paper, we propose an adaptive algorithm for processing in-network aggregation in sensor nodes of a WSN, called ADAGA (ADaptive AGgregation Algorithm for sensor networks). The ADAGA adapts its behavior according to memory and energy usage by dynamically adjusting data-collection and data-sending time intervals. The results obtained through experiments prove the efficiency of ADAGA.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: EIT - Escalonador Inteligente de Transaзхes

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXI Simpуsio Brasileiro de Banco de Dados
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do XXI Simpуsio Brasileiro de Banco de Dados

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BRAYNER, A.;Brayner, A;Brayner, Angelo;BRAYNER, A.;BRAYNER, ВNGELO;Brayner, A.R.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Serializability has been used as a criterion to correctly synchronize the execution of concurrent operations belonging to several transactions. For that reason, concurrency control protocols should yield schedules using serializability. Concurrency control protocols may present an aggressive or conservative behavior. This paper presents the Transaction Intelligent Scheduler (EIT), which has the ability to synchronize database operations by using concurrency protocols with an aggressive or conservative behavior. EIT adapts its behavior dynamically according to characteristics of the computing environment where it is inserted. In order to make such changes, an expert system based on fuzzy logic is one of the components of this scheduler.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Balancing energy consumption and memory usage in sensor data processing

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: the 2007 ACM symposium
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 2007 ACM symposium on Applied computing - SAC '07

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Algorithms for data processing in sensor nodes of wireless sensor networks should be able to handle the resource limitations the nodes face (i.e. energy and memory). An important issue to be considered is that the materialization of large amounts of data in sensor nodes may cause memory overflows and consequently data losses. On the other hand, the excessive sending of data packets to other nodes may result in unacceptable energy consumption levels. Some alternatives to save energy and also avoid memory overflows involve in-network aggregation and reductions in sensor activities (when sensor nodes experience resource constraints). In this paper we study energy-memory tradeoffs in sensor nodes and how they affect the accuracy of query results in wireless sensor networks. We propose an adaptive data processing strategy to balance energy consumption and memory usage at sensor node level. Our goal is to maximize sensor lifetime while also maintaining the accuracy of query results. We implemented our approach by means of an algorithm called ADAGA (ADaptive AGgregation Algorithm for sensor networks), which process in-network aggregation in sensor nodes. ADAGA is able to adapt its behavior according to energy and memory availabilities by dynamically adjusting data collection and data sending intervals. The results on the efficiency of our approach are also presented .

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A mechanism for replicated data consistency in mobile computing environments

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: the 2007 ACM symposium
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 2007 ACM symposium on Applied computing - SAC '07

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The recent advances in portable computers together with the developments in wireless communication technology are allowing users of portable equipment to maintain the network connection while they move about freely, having access to shared resources, services and information. This paradigm is called mobile computing. Mobile computing allows for the development of new and sophisticated database applications. Such applications require the reading of current and consistent data. In order to improve the data availability, increase performance and maximize throughput, data replication is used. However, due to inherent limitations in mobile and other loosely-coupled environments, the concurrency control and replica control mechanisms must be revisited. This paper proposes a new protocol that guarantees the consistency of replicated data in a mobile computing environment, while provide high data availability and ensure an eventual replica convergence towards a strongly consistent state. Our protocol introduces a significant improvement over other solutions by using a consolidated correctness criterion, Serializability, and relaxing the isolation property, beyond, reduces the number of messages exchanged between the hosts and ensures that the transaction operations are executed only once.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: AJAX: An Adaptive Join Algorithm for Extreme Restrictions

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXII Simpуsio Brasileiro de Banco de Dados
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Simpуsio Brasileiro de Banco de Dados

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BRAYNER, A.;Brayner, A;Brayner, Angelo;BRAYNER, A.;BRAYNER, ВNGELO;Brayner, A.R.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In a mobile ad hoc network (MANET), the nodes represent mobile computers in which database systems may reside. Such mobile computers (nodes) are free to move arbitrarily. In such an environment, we may have a collection of autonomous, distributed, heterogeneous and mobile databases (denoted Mobile Database Community or MDBC). Thus, each database user (in a mobile host) can access databases belonging to an MDBC through the MANET. Traditional query processing techniques fail to support the access to databases in an MDBC, since data delivery rate in such an environment becomes unpredictable and mobile hosts may suffer from limited available main memory to process some query operators (e.g., join). To react to those events, this paper presents an adaptive join operator, called AJAX, for processing join operations on mobile databases in an MDBC. AJAX ensures: (i) incremental production of results as soon as the data become available; (ii) progress of the query processing even when the delivery of data is blocked, and; (iii) reaction to situations of memory limitation on the execution of operator. Cost estimation and experimental results are presented to evidence that AJAX is an effective solution for processing join operation on mobile databases.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Introducing self-adaptability into transaction processing

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: the 2008 ACM symposium
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 2008 ACM symposium on Applied computing - SAC '08

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In a database system, the scheduler has the goal of synchronizing operations belonging to several concurrent transactions. In order to achieve its goal, the scheduler implements a concurrency control protocol, which may have either conservative or aggressive behavior. This paper presents a self-adaptable scheduler, called Intelligent Transaction Scheduler (ITS), which has the ability of dynamically changing its behavior (from conservative to aggressive and vice-versa) to adapt itself to the characteristics of the computing environment (e.g., the aborted transaction rate and conflicting operation rate). The proposed scheduler adapts its behavior without any human interference by using an expert system based on fuzzy logic. In order to evaluate ITS, it was applied in a Mobile Database Community (MDBC). An MDBC can be characterized as a dynamically configurable environment, since an MDBC is a dynamic collection of autonomous mobile databases, interconnected through a mobile ad hoc network (MANET). Therefore, self-adaptability plays a key role for schedulers running in dynamically configurable environments. The experimentation results show the efficiency of ITS for synchronizing transactions in MDBCs.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Agregaзгo e Prediзгo de Dados Em Rede com Precisгo Ajustбvel no Processamento de Consultas em Redes de Sensores Sem Fio

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do XXIII Simpуsio Brasileiro de Banco de Dados

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Muitas pesquisas em redes de sensores sem fio (RSSF) tкm sido desenvolvidas nos ъltimos anos, com foco na economia de energia dos nуs sensores. Para alcanзar este objetivo, tais pesquisas utilizam como estratйgia a reduзгo de dados enviados na rede. Neste trabalho, й proposta uma estratйgia eficiente de agregaзгo e prediзгo de dados em RSSF, com este objetivo, aumentando a vida ъtil da RSSF. Alйm do uso da agregaзгo em rede, a proposta apresentada neste artigo introduz o conceito de prediзгo em rede, realizada no processamento de consultas sobre RSSFs. A prediзгo proposta utiliza um modelo de regressгo linear, com base nos dados coletados de um ъnico sensor ou com base nos dados de um subconjunto de sensores. Ela й executada de forma distribuнda nos diversos sensores de uma RSSF. Os resultados experimentais mostram que a estratйgia proposta pode reduzir significativamente o consumo de energia em RSSFs.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Using transaction isolation levels for ensuring replicated database consistency in mobile computing environments

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: the Eighth ACM International Workshop
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the Eighth ACM International Workshop on Data Engineering for Wireless and Mobile Access - MobiDE '09

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Replicating databases over several servers is an efficient strat- egy to improve data availability and to increase transac- tion throughput rate. However, due to inherent limita- tions of mobile and other loosely-coupled environments, the replica control protocols responsible for ensuring replicated database consistency should be revisited. This paper pro- poses a new replica control protocol which guarantees the consistency of replicated databases in a mobile computing environment. The key benefit of the proposed protocol is to ensure consistency by means of the notion of transaction iso- lation levels without the use of a locking mechanism. Thus, a user may trade the degree of replica consistency for a po- tential increase in data availability and transaction through- put rate. The proposed protocol uses a read-any/write-any approach and reduces the number of messages exchanged among the replicated servers. Experimental results show the potential efficiency of the proposed approach.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this work, we present a mechanism, denoted ADAGA − P∗ , for managing sensor-field regression models. ADAGA − P∗ implements an in-network data prediction mechanism in order to only trans- mit data which are novelties for a regression model applied by ADAGA − P∗ . Experiments using real data have been executed to validate our approach. The results show that ADAGA − P∗ is quite efficient regarding communication cost and the number of executed float-point operations. In fact, the energy consumption rate to run ADAGA − P∗ is 15 times lower than the energy consumed by kernel distributed regression for an RMSE difference of 0.003.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: On mobile transaction processing in dynamically configurable mobile database communities

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: International Journal of Parallel, Emergent and Distributed Systems (Print)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The topology of a mobile ad hoc network (MANET) may change randomly and rapidly at unpredictable time, since nodes are free to move arbitrarily. In such an environment, we may have a collection of autonomous, distributed, heterogeneous and mobile databases (denoted Mobile Database Community or MDBC). This paper describes an approach for controlling concurrency of mobile transactions executed in MDBCs. The proposed approach is based on the use of semantic knowledge to relax the notion of absolute transaction atomicity. Supported by this new concept of atomicity, we propose a new correctness criterion, denoted mobile semantic serializability, for the execution of concurrent transactions in MDBCs. The proposed correctness criterion provides a high degree of inter-transaction parallelism and ensures consistency of the mobile database.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The topology of a mobile ad hoc network (MANET) may change randomly and rapidly at unpredictable time, since nodes are free to move arbitrarily. In such an environment, we may have a collection of autonomous, distributed, heterogeneous and mobile databases (denoted Mobile Database Community or MDBC). This paper describes an approach for controlling concurrency of mobile transactions executed in MDBCs. The proposed approach is based on the use of semantic knowledge to relax the notion of absolute transaction atomicity. Supported by this new concept of atomicity, we propose a new correctness criterion, denoted mobile semantic serializability, for the execution of concurrent transactions in MDBCs. The proposed correctness criterion provides a high degree of inter-transaction parallelism and ensures consistency of the mobile database.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: An Adaptive In-network Aggregation Operator for Query Processing in Wireless Sensor Networks

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: The Journal of Systems and Software

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BRAYNER, A.;Brayner, A;Brayner, Angelo;BRAYNER, A.;BRAYNER, ВNGELO;Brayner, A.R.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A wireless sensor network (WSN) is composed of tens or hundreds of spatially distributed autonomous nodes, called sensors. Sensors are devices used to collect data from the environment related to the detection or measurement of physical phenomena. In fact, a WSN consists of groups of sensors where each group is responsible for providing information about one or more physical phenomena (e.g., group for collecting temperature data). Sensors are limited in power, computational capacity, and memory. Therefore, a query engine and query operators for processing queries in WSNs should be able to handle resource limitations such as memory and battery life. Adaptability has been explored as an alternative approach when dealing with these conditions. Adaptive query operators (algorithms) can adjust their behavior in response to specific events that take place during data processing. In this paper, we propose an adaptive in-network aggregation operator for query processing in sensor nodes of a WSN, called ADAGA (ADaptive AGgregation Algorithm for sensor networks). The ADAGA adapts its behavior according to memory and energy usage by dynamically adjusting data-collection and data-sending time intervals. ADAGA can correctly aggregate data in WSNs with packet replication. Moreover, ADAGA is able to predict non-performed detection values by analyzing collected values. Thus, ADAGA is able to produce results as close as possible to real results (obtained when no resource constraint is faced). The results obtained through experiments prove the efficiency of ADAGA.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: A Self-adaptable Scheduler for Synchronizing Transactions in Dynamically Configurable Environments

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BRAYNER, A.;Brayner, A;Brayner, Angelo;BRAYNER, A.;BRAYNER, ВNGELO;Brayner, A.R.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In a database system, the scheduler has the goal of synchronizing operations belonging to several concurrent transactions. In order to achieve its goal, the scheduler implements a concurrency control protocol, which may have either conservative or aggressive behavior. Thus, existing database systems have schedulers with static behavior (conservative or aggressive), since they use a fixed concurrency protocol. This paper presents a self-adaptable scheduler, called Intelligent Transaction Scheduler (ITS), which has the ability of dynamically changing its behavior (from conservative to aggressive and vice-versa) to adapt itself to the characteristics of the computing environment (e.g., the aborted transaction rate and conflicting operation rate). The proposed scheduler adapts its behavior without any human interference by using an expert system based on fuzzy logic. Self-adaptability is a key feature for schedulers running in a dynamically configurable environment, whose configuration (topology) may change dynamically, such as a Mobile Database Community (MDBC). An MDBC is a dynamic collection of autonomous mobile databases, interconnected through a mobile ad hoc network (MANET), where new participants may join the MDBC or a participant may permanently or transiently disconnect from the MDBC. Besides having adaptive behavior, ITS can implement different correctness criteria, such as classical (syntactic) serializability and semantic serializability. The experimentation results presented in this paper prove the efficiency of ITS for synchronizing transactions in MDBCs

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: On query processing in wireless sensor networks using classes of quality of queries
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: On query processing in wireless sensor networks using classes of quality of queries

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper introduces the concept of quality of queries (QoQs) towards a more adaptive query processing in wireless sensor networks (WSNs). This approach aims at the intelligent consumption of the limited resources (energy and memory) available in these networks while still delivering a reasonable level of data quality as expected by client applications. In a nutshell, the concept of QoQ stipulates that the results of different queries injected into the same WSN can be tailored according to different criteria, in particular the levels of query result accuracy and energy consumption. For this purpose, four classes of QoQ (CoQoQ) are specified having in mind distinct requirements in terms of these criteria. To allow the implementation of these classes in a real WSN setting, a new novelty-detection based algorithm, referred to as AdaQuali (which stands for ??ADAptive QUALIty control for query processing in WSN??), is also proposed in a manner as to control the sensor node activities through the dynamic adjustment of their rates of data collection and transmission. In order to validate the novel approach, simulations with a prototype implemented in Sinalgo have been conducted over real temperature data. The results achieved evidence the suitability of the proposal and point to gains of up to 66.76%, for different CoQoQ, in terms of reduction in energy consumption.

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BRAYNER, A.;Brayner, A;Brayner, Angelo;BRAYNER, A.;BRAYNER, ВNGELO;Brayner, A.R.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Integrating data sources published on the web requires an integration strategy that guarantees local data sources autonomy. Multidatabase System (MDBS) has been consolidated as an approach to integrate multiple heterogeneous and distributed data sources in flexible and dynamic environments such as the Web. A key property of MDBSs is to guarantee a higher degree of local autonomy. In order to adopt the MDBS strategy, it is necessary to use a query language, called multidatabase language (MDL), which provides the necessary constructs for jointly manipulating and accessing data in heterogeneous data sources. In other words, the MDL is responsible for solving integration conflicts. This chapter describes an extension to the XQuery language, called MXQuery, which supports queries over several data sources and solves integration problems as semantic heterogeneity and incomplete information.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A estrutura de Arquivo grade (grid file) fo proposta para a indexaзгo de dados espacias. DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: AMDB: An Approach for Sharing Mobile Databases

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In an environment with support for mobile computing, we may have a collection of autonomous, distributed, heterogeneous and mobile databases, denoted Mobile Database Community (MDBC), in which each database user can access databases in the community through a wireless communication infrastructure. In such an environment, new participants may join to an MDBC as they move within communication range of one or more hosts which are members of the MDBC. Furthermore, MDBC participants may transiently disconnect from the network due to communication disruptions or to save power. Therefore, an MDBC can be characterized as a dynamically configurable environment. This work describes an agent-based architecture, denoted AMDB (Accessing Mobile Databases), which enables such communities to be formed opportunistically over mobile database hosts in ad hoc configurable environments. The AMDB architecture is fully distributed and has the capability of exploiting physical mobility of hosts and logical mobility of database queries and their results across mobile hosts.The architecture addresses two important issues in mobile database area. First, the query processing problem is discussed. A query processing mechanism is proposed for the AMDB architecture. Second, the transaction processing problem is addressed. A mobile transaction model and a commit protocol are proposed.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Data Warehousing й um recurso poderoso utilizado pelas organizaзхes para suporte ao processo de tomada de decisгo. Esta tecnologia incorpora um repositуrio de dados analнtico - Data Warehouse (DW) e tecnologias modernas, que processam e transformam dados em informaзхes confiбveis e facilmente acessнveis. No entanto, desenvolver um DW й um processo complexo e uma atividade cara em desenvolvimento e gerenciamento de sistemas de informaзхes, que requer estratйgias adaptadas аs caracterнsticas e necessidades da organizaзгo onde serб implantado. Este trabalho apresenta uma metodologia de desenvolvimento de DW - X-Meta. Esta metodologia й direcionada a organizaзхes sem tradiзгo no uso de sistemas automatizados de apoio а decisгo e pode ser utilizada pelo pessoal interno da organizaзгo, inexperiente na tecnologia de DW, mas capacitado tecnicamente em desenvolvimento de sistemas convencionais e tecnologia de banco de dados. Alйm disso, uma estratйgia para criaзгo e gerenciamento de metadados integrado ao processo de desenvolvimento й proposta, para capturar o conhecimento organizacional e minimizar os problemas causados pela rotatividade dos funcionбrios, dentro e entre organizaзхes. O presente trabalho tambйm apresenta a aplicaзгo da metodologia X-Meta em um caso real.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: MDBA: UMA ARQUITETURA PARA ADMINISTRAЗГO REMOTA DE BANCO DE DADOS EM AMBIENTES DE COMPUTAЗГO UBНQUA

DETALHAMENTO-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-P.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Fundaзгo Cearense de Apoio ao Desenvolvimento Cientнfico e Tecnolуgico

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-1: Administraзгo de servidores de bancos de dados

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This work presents a context-aware tool for remote data base administration that is executed in mobile devices, MDBA (Mobile Database Administrator). The MDBA enables database administrators (DBAs) to perform their tasks by automatically identifying databases and the wireless communication structure of a given mobile computational environment. The proposed tool has properties which integrate features of mobile computation pervasive computation paradigms and introduces also the notion of remote database administration, which is supported by a new computational paradigm, denoted ubiquitous computation. Therefore, the MDBA tool provides database administration services anywhere and anytime. Furthermore, the MDBA enables DBAs to manage databases residing in mobile hosts or fixed hosts.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: MobiJoin: Um Operador de Junзгo para Bancos de Dados Mуveis

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In a mobile ad hoc network (MANET) nodes are free to move arbitrarily. The nodes represent mobile computers in which database systems may reside. In such an environment, we may have a collection of autonomous, distributed, heterogeneous and mobile databases (denoted Mobile Database Community or MDBC), where each database user (in a mobile host) can access databases of the collection through the MANET. Traditional query processing techniques fail to support the access to databases in an MDBC, since data delivery rate in such an environment becomes unpredictable and mobile hosts may suffer from limited available main memory to process some query operators (e.g., join). To react to those events, we propose an adaptive operator, called MobiJoin, for processing join operations on mobile databases in an MDBC. MobiJoin ensures: (i) incremental production of results as soon as the data become available; (ii) progress of the query processing even when the delivery of data is blocked, and; (iii) reaction to situations of memory limitation on the execution of operator. Cost estimation and experimental results of the MobiJoin are presented to evidence that the proposed operator is an effective solution for processing join on mobile databases.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Uma Abordagem para Otimizar o Processamento de Consultas em Ambientes com Recursos Computacionais Limitados

DETALHAMENTO-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-P.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Coordenaзгo de Aperfeiзoamento de Pessoal de Nнvel Superior

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Atualmente, carregar dados em pequenos dispositivos computacionais, tais como, palmtops, PDAs, telefones celulares, smartcards etc, estб se tornando um hбbito muito natural. Isso porque tais dispositivos nos permitem acessar informaзхes e serviзos importantes, a qualquer hora e em qualquer lugar, sem obrigatoriamente estarmos conectados a uma rede de computadores. Entretanto, esses dispositivos sгo caracterizados como ambientes com capacidades de processamento e memуria altamente reduzidas, especialmente quando falamos de uma das mais novas aquisiзхes da tecnologia da informaзгo: os smartcards. Do tamanho de um cartгo de crйdito convencional, um smartcard possui um microchip embutido que armazena e processa dados eletrфnicos. Hoje, estгo entre os mais modernos e seguros dispositivos computacionais portбteis existentes. Assim, utilizaremos os smartcards como cenбrio do nosso trabalho. Nesse contexto, nosso trabalho enfoca o problema de processamento eficiente de consultas em ambientes computacionais com recursos limitados, tais como em smartcads. Serгo especificadas e implementadas duas estruturas de armazenamento, denominadas MSJoin e MSJoin+, que tкm como principal objetivo otimizar a execuзгo de junзхes atravйs do algoritmo merge-join, levando em conta sua baixa estimativa de custo.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: ACQUA: Um Modelo de Dados para Representar Objetos Relacionados a Recursos Hнdricos em Sistemas de Informaзгo Geogrбfica

DETALHAMENTO-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-P.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Fundaзгo Cearense de Apoio ao Desenvolvimento Cientнfico e Tecnolуgico

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This work proposes a conceptual data model, called ACQUA, for representing water resources. The proposed model has the capability of capturing the semantics of geographic phenomena, which are related with water resources, such as reservoirs, rivers, channels, pipelines, lakes and singularities (e.g. waterwithdrawal, waterdischarge, confluence, riverhead and monitoring-station). Using ACQUA it is possible to model the complex water resources network, its physical properties and its spatial information, within a geographic context. The model captures and represents information about an area and may be used as support for urban planning, water-related crisis management (such as, water offer and demand during a dry period) or as a basis for scenario simulation.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Indexaзгo de Objetos Mуveis Utilizando Бrvores TPKD

DETALHAMENTO-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-P.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Fundaзгo Cearense de Apoio ao Desenvolvimento Cientнfico e Tecnolуgico

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Objetos espaciais devem ser indexados por mais de uma chave de busca, onde cada chave de busca representa sua posiзгo em um eixo de coordenadas. Muitas propostas tкm sido apresentadas para solucionar o problema de indexaзгo de objetos espaciais. Contudo, o avanзo na бrea de comunicaзгo sem fio, fez surgiu um nicho de aplicaзхes, como, por exemplo, monitoramento de trбfego aйreo e terrestre, comйrcio eletrфnico mуvel e prediзгo de posicionamento de telefones mуveis em redes de telefonia celular, que requerem o acesso a dados de objetos espaciais que estгo em contнnuo movimento.Garantir um acesso eficiente a tais dados implica na existкncia de tйcnicas de indexaзгo eficiente. As vбrias propostas de indexaзгo de objetos mуveis, ao invйs de utilizarem a atualizaзгo contнnua da posiзгo dos objetos, utilizam uma atualizaзгo periуdica da posiзгo e da velocidade do objeto e uma funзгo linear de previsгo de posiзгo futura, baseada em tais informaзхes. Neste trabalho serб apresentada uma tйcnica de indexaзгo de objetos mуveis baseada na estrutura de бrvore kd, onde a funзгo de previsгo de movimento й quadrбtica e baseada nos vetores posiзгo, velocidade e aceleraзгo. A tйcnica proposta apresenta baixos custos computacionais para gerar e balancear бrvores kd, alйm de garantir um acesso eficiente a entradas na бrvore log M, onde M representa o nъmero de nуs folhas. Tais propriedades tornam a tйcnica proposta mais precisa e eficiente (quanto а localizaзгo de dados) que бrvores TPR, por exemplo, proposta por Saltenis et al.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Indexaзгo de Objetos Mуveis: Uma estratйgia para garantir alocaзгo dinвmica de canais em redes celulares

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In cellular networks, communication between mobile devices is accomplished through base stations (fixed antennas). The base station allocates communication channels whenever a mobile device (a cell phone, for example) in its area of coverage requests communication with some other device (mobile or fixed). With the rapidly growing number of mobile devices, the use of communication channels available in cellular networks needs to be optimized. Otherwise the network's bandwidth would have to be increased, raising operational costs significantly. To efficiently optimize the use of communication channels in cellular networks dynamic (on-the-fly) channel allocation may be employed, using an algorithm for the purpose; however such algorithms demand previous knowledge of the number of mobile devices in the area of coverage of a given base station. In this paper, we propose a strategy to support dynamic channel allocation in cellular networks by predicting the number of mobile devices in the area covered by a base station at any given moment. The proposed strategy is based on an indexing mechanism for mobile objects.

SESAMO: Um controlador de concorrкncia baseado serialidade semвntica para sistemas de bancos de dados mъltiplos e mуveis

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The nodes of a mobile ad hoc network (MANET) represent mobile computers in which database systems (DBSs) may reside. In such an environment, we may have a mobile multidatabase system (mobile MDBS), i.e., a collection of autonomous, distributed, heterogeneous and mobile DBSs, where each mobile computer can access multiple DBSs of that collection by means of global transactions. In this paper we propose SESAMO, which is a concurrency control mechanism that does not require that a single mobile host (a node in MANET) plays the role of the centralized coordinator for all global transactions executed in the mobile MDBS. Moreover, SESAMO allows that subtransactions commit independently of the commitment of their respective global transactions, since it is based on the Semantic Serializability, which relaxes global serializability.

DETALHAMENTO-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-P.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Fundaзгo Cearense de Apoio ao Desenvolvimento Cientнfico e Tecnolуgico

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In a mobile ad hoc network (MANET), the nodes represent mobile computers in which database systems may reside. Such mobile computers (nodes) are free to move arbitrarily. In such an environment, we may have a collection of autonomous, distributed, heterogeneous and mobile databases (denoted Mobile Database Community or MDBC). Thus, each database user (in a mobile host) can access databases belonging to an MDBC through the MANET. Traditional query processing techniques fail to support the access to databases in an MDBC, since data delivery rate in such an environment becomes unpredictable and mobile hosts may suffer from limited available main memory to process some query operators (e.g., join). To react to those events, this dissertation presents an adaptive join operator, called AJAX, for processing join operations on mobile databases in an MDBC. AJAX ensures: (i) incremental production of results as soon as the data become available; (ii) progress of the query processing even when the delivery of data is blocked, and; (iii) reaction to situations of memory limitation on the execution of operator. Cost estimation and experimental results are presented to evidence that AJAX is an effective solution for processing join operation on mobile databases.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Processamento de Consultas em Redes de Sensores sem Fio: Uma Abordagem de Detecзгo de Novidades para o Controle da Qualidade dos Serviзos das Consultas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This work presents an approach for adapting query processing in wireless sensor networks (WSN) based on the notions of quality of query services (QoQS) and novelty detection (ND). While the former concept captures the idea of possibly having different queries serviced in different ways by the same WSN, the second relates to a machine learning technique embedded in the WSN components that allows them to modify their query processing behavior in a dynamic fashion. This approach aims at the intelligent consumption of the limited resources available in these networks while still trying to deliver the data quality as expected by their client applications. In this context, four classes of QoQS (CoQoS) have been specified having in mind distinct levels of requirements in terms of accuracy and temporal behavior of the sensed data. Moreover, a new ND-based algorithm, named as AdaQuali (after ADAptive QUALIty control for query processing in WSN), is introduced in detail as a way to control the sensor node activities through the adjustment of their rates of data collection and transmission. For validation purposes, experiments with a simulation prototype have been conducted over real data, and the results achieved so far point to gains in terms of energy consumption reduction that vary from 1.73% to 42.99% for different CoQoS.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Muitas pesquisas em redes de sensores sem fio (RSSF) tкm sido desenvolvidas nos ъltimos anos, com foco na economia de energia dos nуs sensores. Para alcanзar este objetivo, tais pesquisas utilizam como estratйgia a reduзгo de dados enviados na rede. Neste trabalho, й proposta uma estratйgia eficiente de agregaзгo e prediзгo de dados em RSSF, com o objetivo de reduzir o volume de dados que trafegam em uma RSSF, aumentando, desta forma, a vida ъtil da RSSF. Alйm do uso da agregaзгo em rede, estratйgia bastante utilizada para reduзгo de dados transmitidos em uma RSSF, a proposta apresentada neste trabalho introduz o conceito de prediзхes dos dados em rede, realizada no processamento de consultas sobre RSSFs. A estratйgia de prediзгo proposta utiliza um modelo de regressгo linear, com base nos dados coletados a partir de um ъnico sensor ou com base nos dados de um subconjunto de sensores. A estratйgia de prediзгo proposta й executada de forma distribuнda nos diversos sensores de uma RSSF. Os resultados experimentais mostram que a estratйgia proposta pode reduzir significativamente o consumo de energia em RSSFs

DETALHAMENTO-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-P.NOME-DA-INSTITUICAO: Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Norte
DETALHAMENTO-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-P.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Cientнfico e Tecnolуgico

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Para garantir a consistкncia do banco de dados, um sistema de banco de dados deve sincronizar as operaзхes das transaзхes concorrentes executadas sobre esse banco. O componente do sistema de banco de dados responsбvel por tal sincronizaзгo й o escalonador. O escalonador sincroniza operaзхes de diferentes transaзхes atravйs dos protocolos de controle de concorrкncia. Os protocolos de controle de concorrкncia podem apresentar diferentes comportamentos: em geral, esse comportamento do escalonador pode ser classificado como agressivo ou conservador. Esta tese apresenta o Escalonador Inteligente de Transaзхes (EIT), o qual tem a habilidade de sincronizar a execuзгo das transaзхes concorrentes de maneira adaptativa. Este escalonador adapta seu comportamento (agressivo ou conservador) de acordo com as caracterнsticas do ambiente computacional onde estб inserido, usando um sistema especialista baseado em lуgica fuzzy. O EIT foi desenvolvido para trabalhar com protocolos baseados nos critйrios de corretude de serializabilidade convencional e serializabilidade semвntica. Para avaliar o desempenho do EIT em relaзгo aos escalonadores com comportamento exclusivamente conservador ou agressivo, ele foi usado em um ambiente dinвmico, uma Comunidade de Banco de Dados Mуveis (MDBC ? Mobile Database Community). Foi implementado um simulador de MDBC e um conjunto de testes foi executado. Os resultados obtidos provaram a eficiкncia do EIT, um escalonador inteligente, quando utilizado em um ambiente dinвmico de banco de dados.
